title: Horsetail Falls (Tasmania, Australia)
data: 42°04′44″S 145°35′10″E﻿ / ﻿42.079°S 145.586°E﻿ / -42.079; 145.586 Horsetail Falls is a seasonal waterfall near Queenstown, Tasmania. The falls cascades over 50 metres down a steep cliff face, and can be seen from the road. A boardwalk giving closer access was opened in 2017.[1] This Tasmania geography article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
